paragraphs.text:
%md
## Selecting a wine to bring to a party that is likley to be good and is also inexpensive!
### We've all been there.   We are invited to a party and want to bring something to contribute.   A bottle of wine is always a good option.   But which one?   There are so many!   And we don't want to break the bank for our party gift.   Let's try to use the Autonomous Database and Oracle Machine Learning to find a likely tasty and likley to be rated greater than 90 Points (GT_90_Points) adult beverage that is also affordable (Under $35).  
##### Original data comes from Kaggle WineReviews130K data = 130k wine reviews with variety, location, winery, price, and description etc.   Wine Reviews and Twitter Handle were removed.   Points was binned to GT_90 and LT_90 <https://www.kaggle.com/zynicide/wine-reviews>  
#### Updated: August 2020, Authors:  Charlie Berger, Dhvani Sheth, Siddesh Ujini

msg.data:
Selecting a wine to bring to a party that is likley to be good and is also inexpensive!

We've all been there. We are invited to a party and want to bring something to contribute. A bottle of wine is always a good option. But which one? There are so many! And we don't want to break the bank for our party gift. Let's try to use the Autonomous Database and Oracle Machine Learning to find a likely tasty and likley to be rated greater than 90 Points (GT_90_Points) adult beverage that is also affordable (Under $35).

Original data comes from Kaggle WineReviews130K data = 130k wine reviews with variety, location, winery, price, and description etc. Wine Reviews and Twitter Handle were removed. Points was binned to GT_90 and LT_90 https://www.kaggle.com/zynicide/wine-reviews

Updated: August 2020, Authors: Charlie Berger, Dhvani Sheth, Siddesh Ujini

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Business Problem

#### Based on previous wine reviews and data about price, province, variety and other wine attributes, build a predictive model to identify wines most likely to have points > 92.

msg.data:
Business Problem

Based on previous wine reviews and data about price, province, variety and other wine attributes, build a predictive model to identify wines most likely to have points > 92.

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Data Preparation

msg.data: Data Preparation

paragraphs.title: Add POINTS_BIN column
paragraphs.text:
%sql
ALTER TABLE WineReviews130K_bin ADD POINTS_BIN VARCHAR2(15);

paragraphs.title: Populate POINTS_BIN column as Greater than 90 points and Less than 90 points
paragraphs.text:
%script

UPDATE WineReviews130K_bin
SET POINTS_BIN = 'GT_90_Points'
WHERE EXISTS (SELECT WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT.ID
        FROM WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT
        WHERE WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT.POINTS >= 90 and WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT.ID = WineReviews130K_bin.ID);

UPDATE WineReviews130K_bin
SET POINTS_BIN = 'LT_90_Points'
WHERE EXISTS (SELECT WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT.ID
        FROM WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT
        WHERE WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT.POINTS < 90 and WINEREVIEWS130KTEXT.ID = WineReviews130K_bin.ID);

%sql
select * from WineReviews130K_bin;

The medium finish shows depth and length.
42375	France		83	13	Bordeaux	Bordeaux		Roger Voss	@vossroger	Ch?›teau de Beauregard-Ducourt 2011  Bordeaux	Bordeaux-style Red Blend	Ch?›teau de Beauregard-Ducourt	LT_90_Points	Ripe and juicy, this smooth, simple wine is ready to drink. Juicy black currant fruits are polished by the wood aging.

Martini	GT_90_Points	From a two-acre block planted to the variety within this stately place, more famous for Zinfandel and Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine is herbal in dried sage, girded in big tannin and exhibiting plenty of density. 12034	Italy	Rapet	90	103	Piedmont	Barolo		Kerin Oƒ??Keefe	@kerinokeefe	Ca'Rom?? 2010 Rapet  (Barolo)	Nebbiolo	Ca'Rom??	GT_90_Points	Surprisingly ripe and dense for the vintage, this opens with aromas of plum, vanilla and chocolate that carry over to the palate along with espresso and coffee. 69172	US	Awesome Ros??	87	22	California	Santa Ynez Valley	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Sevtap 2012 Awesome Ros?? Sangiovese (Santa Ynez Valley)	Sangiovese	Sevtap	LT_90_Points	Nearly purple in color, it is equally intense in flavor, almost like sipping a straight red wine, save for the low alcohol. This bottling, made by Turkish-born, former oil rig construction worker Ertugrul ƒ??Artƒ?� Sevtap, begins with candied pecans and other nutty aromas, then brings red apple, light herbals, and hazelnut to the palate. 117388	Romania	Dulce	85	320	V?›nju Mare			Susan Kostrzewa	@suskostrzewa	Sirena Dunarii 2000 Dulce Riesling (V?›nju Mare)	Riesling	Sirena Dunarii	LT_90_Points	This collectible botrytis Riesling grown on the banks of the Danube in Romania is very concentrated, with heady flavors of honey, caramel and apricot and a nutty overall character. 13327	Germany	Berg Roxheim Sp??tlese	90	49	Nahe			Anna Lee C. (Champagne)	Champagne Blend	Nicolas Feuillatte	LT_90_Points	With a deep-pink color, this is a soft wine full of fruit. paragraphs.title: Compare Wines from Different Countries
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Compare wines from Different Countries
-- Hint: Choose different countries from the drop down

SELECT * FROM WineReviews130K_bin WHERE COUNTRY = ${COUNTRY='Germany', 'Germany'|'Spain'|'Chile'|'US'|'Argentine'|'Italy'|'Australia'};

msg.data:
ID	COUNTRY	DESIGNATION	POINTS	PRICE	PROVINCE	REGION_1	REGION_2	TASTER_NAME	TASTER_TWITTER_HANDLE	TITLE	VARIETY	WINERY	POINTS_BIN	DESCRIPTION
78680	Australia	Old Garden	91	95	South Australia	Barossa		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Hewitson 2009 Old Garden Mourv??dre (Barossa)	Mourv??dre	Hewitson	GT_90_Points	According to Hewitson, the Old Gardenƒ??source for this wineƒ??was planted in 1853, likely making it the oldest Mourv??dre in existence. This vintage is bright-fruited, offering notes of strawberry, raspberry and even watermelon, framed by hints of cedar, vanilla and dark chocolate. The tannins are supple, letting crisp acidity drive the long finish.
27377	Australia		85	12	Australia Other	South Eastern Australia				Angus The Bull 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (South Eastern Australia)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Angus The Bull	LT_90_Points	A sweet attack of ripe fruit is the opener for a crisp palate of raspberry jam, set in a bed of soft tannins. Juicy and extracted, this is one to catch young.
86423	Australia	Lady of the Lake Single Site	85	14	South Australia	Langhorne Creek		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Zonte's Footstep 2009 Lady of the Lake Single Site Viognier (Langhorne Creek)	Viognier	Zonte's Footstep	LT_90_Points	This South Australia Viognier comes across as restrained on the nose, offering up little more than some vaguely smoky or flinty notes, then delivers melon, pear and spice notes via a full-bodied, slightly oily-textured palate. Turns crisp and citrusy on the finish.
85060	Australia	Gamekeeper's	89	13	South Australia	Barossa		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	St Hallett 2008 Gamekeeper's Shiraz (Barossa)	Shiraz	St Hallett	LT_90_Points	Full bodied and supple, this nicely balanced Barossa Shiraz shows that value still exists even in big-name regions of Australia. Intense blueberry and spice aromas give way to mixed berries and vanilla on the palate, and if it's not overly complex, it's a still a concentrated mouthful of Shiraz at a bargain price.
22615	Australia	The Violinist	89	20	South Australia	McLaren Vale		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Mollydooker 2011 The Violinist Verdelho (McLaren Vale)	Verdelho	Mollydooker	LT_90_Points	Looking for something different to serve with your cheese course? This aged white might be just the thing. Scents of grape skins and honey waft from the glass, followed by flavors akin to honey, beeswax and bitter almond. It tastes like there's a hint of residual sugar as well.
80149	Australia		88	25	New South Wales	Hunter Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Tyrrell's 2015 Semillon (Hunter Valley)	S??millon	Tyrrell's	LT_90_Points	This ticks all the boxes of young Hunter Semillon: green, acidic, underripe. Serve it with oysters now (it makes a convincing pairing), or wait 5ƒ??8 years for additional richness and complexity to emerge.
129389	Australia		85	5	Australia Other	South Eastern Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Banrock Station 2006 Shiraz (South Eastern Australia)	Shiraz	Banrock Station	LT_90_Points	Banrock Station's 2006 Shiraz is a throwback to the kind of super value Australian wines used to provide with more regularity. Look for it by the glass or buy it by the case for entertaining on a budget.
107570	Australia	The Phantom	88	20	South Australia	McLaren Vale		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Gemtree 2008 The Phantom Petit Verdot (McLaren Vale)	Petit Verdot	Gemtree	LT_90_Points	Petit Verdot is a character actor who's never really grabbed the spotlight for itself, but makes an interesting appearance now and again. 61395	Australia	Basalt Block	90	15	New South Wales	Hunter Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Hope Estate 2013 Basalt Block Shiraz (Hunter Valley)	Shiraz	Hope Estate	GT_90_Points	This is already showing some evolution in its color, displaying some lightening at its rim. 35487	Australia		90	17	South Australia	Adelaide Hills		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Wakefield 2015 Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)	Pinot Noir	Wakefield	GT_90_Points	A fresh, fruity and fun rendering of Pinot Noir, this medium-bodied wine features lightly floral aromas, red cherry and raspberry fruit and a silky, mouthwatering finish. Drink nowƒ??2020.
4669	Australia	Brut M??thode Traditionelle Sparkling Wine	89	20	Tasmania	Tasmania				42?øS NV Brut M??thode Traditionelle Sparkling Wine  (Tasmania)	Champagne Blend	42?øS	LT_90_Points	Delicate and light-bodied with plenty to love in the nose, including irresistible notes of bread dough, strawberry and lemon which turn to fresh cherries in the mouth. The finish is focused and very crispƒ??just a few paces short of tart, actually. This wine screams for raw oysters.
34186	Australia	Frasca's Lane Vineyard	85	20	Victoria	King Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Nugan Family Estates 2015 Frasca's Lane Vineyard Chardonnay (King Valley)	Chardonnay	Nugan Family Estates	LT_90_Points	This was a perplexing wine to evaluate. The aromas feature toasted hazelnuts, lemon curd, pineapple and more than a hint of banana bread. The fruit is herbal and perhaps a bit tomatoey, but there's enough cherry to hold things together, with smoke and sous-bois notes for complexity. It's a light- to medium-bodied wine that finishes on a crisp note. Drink now.
38988	Australia	Bin 707	95	200	South Australia	South Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Penfolds 2009 Bin 707 Cabernet Sauvignon (South Australia)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Penfolds	GT_90_Points	Penfolds Bin 707 has leapt in quality over the past few vintages. The 2009 features hints of mint, cedar and vanilla accenting ripe cassis fruit. It's full bodied and rich, velvety without being overly soft, with a dusty tannic structure that should support it over two decades or more of aging. Drink 2015ƒ??2030+.
81849	Australia	Hand Picked	90	15	South Australia	Clare Valley				Knappstein 2008 Hand Picked Riesling (Clare Valley)	Riesling	Knappstein	GT_90_Points	Captivating, with zesty lemon and wet stones on the nose, followed by a complex medley of citrus, passionfruit and carnations on the palate. The wine finishes well, with punchy notes of lime marmalade and dry chalk. Try with smoked trout. Drink now for its vibrant fruit or lay down for a few years for more honeyed depth.
32344	Australia	Illicium	89		South Australia	Langhorne Creek		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Heartland 2014 Illicium Shiraz-Cabernet Sauvignon (Langhorne Creek)	Shiraz-Cabernet Sauvignon	Heartland	LT_90_Points	This is the first vintage for this wine, a 50-50 blend of Cabernet and Shiraz matured in French and American oak hogsheads for a year. Vanilla notes frame mixed-berry flavors, then pick up savory hints of beef and espresso on the softly dusty finish. Drink now through 2020.
62856	Australia		84	30	South Australia	Coonawarra				Balnaves of Coonawarra 1999 Chardonnay (Coonawarra)	Chardonnay	Balnaves of Coonawarra	LT_90_Points	Feels rather full in the mouth, but the flavors aren't as big as its body. Dry, citrusy notes (lemon peel, lemonade) play on the palate and the finish. Nose offers lots of toast and butterscotch.
26143	Australia	The Seven Surveys Old Vines	89	15	South Australia	Barossa		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Peter Lehmann 2005 The Seven Surveys Old Vines G-S-M (Barossa)	G-S-M	Peter Lehmann	LT_90_Points	The blend includes just 14% Mourv??dre, with the balance split evenly between Shiraz and Grenache, and the result is a medium-bodied red with soft tannins and plenty of ripe fruit. Blackberry, plum and spice notes show good concentration and some chocolaty overtones. Drink now and over the next several years.
73909	Australia	Sea Mist Single Site	88	15	South Australia	Langhorne Creek		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Zonte's Footstep 2009 Sea Mist Single Site Verdelho (Langhorne Creek)	Verdelho	Zonte's Footstep	LT_90_Points	Smooth, easy-drinking and lushly textured, this Verdelho features peach and grapefruit notes that stay refreshingly clean and crisp on the finish. It should work well as an ap??ritif or with many fish dishes.
25840	Australia		88	14	South Australia	South Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	2 Up 2006 Shiraz (South Australia)	Shiraz	2 Up	LT_90_Points	A warm, inviting wine, with scents of brown sugar, plum and baking spices. The tannins are creamy-soft, imparting a lush texture, balanced by just enough acidity to keep it from being thick or cloying. Finishes with plenty of fruit, plus a dash of chocolate.
76392	Australia	Georgia's Paddock	95	85	Victoria	Heathcote		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Jasper Hill 2012 Georgia's Paddock Shiraz (Heathcote)	Shiraz	Jasper Hill	GT_90_Points	When the alcohol levels are reined in to appropriate levels, this can be one of Australia's top Shiraz. The 2012 is a stunning example of balance and finesse, combining youthful scents of cassis and toasty oak with floral elements. There's ample weight and texture yet silky elegance at the same time, while already complex notes of orange pekoe and black currant are sure to gain even more with five or 10 years of cellaring. Drink 2020ƒ??2030.
95868	Australia	Crossing	84	20	Western Australia	Margaret River		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Juniper 2007 Crossing Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Margaret River)	Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc	Juniper	LT_90_Points	This 68% Semillon and 32% Sauvignon is intensely herbal on the nose, and the green character persists throughout, yet never veers into vegetal. It's cleanly made and medium-bodied, with a crisp finish.
6982	Australia		86	20	Western Australia	Margaret River				Clairault 2016 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)	Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon	Clairault	LT_90_Points	On the riper spectrum rather than youthful and fresh, this shows wet wool, ripe lemons and stone fruit, with a hint of green beans and florals. The palate is backed by searing acidity and a slightly woolly texture. Rather simple in style but it clearly shows the characters of both the Sauvignon Blanc and the S??millon.
44941	Australia		88	25	Western Australia	Margaret River		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Celestial Bay 2004 Shiraz (Margaret River)	Shiraz	Celestial Bay	LT_90_Points	This medium-bodied Shiraz features plenty of spicy complexity and creamy-soft tannins, making it ideal for current consumption. Cedar, vanilla and spice accent raspberry fruit and linger elegantly on the finish.
94931	Australia	Estate Unwooded	88		South Australia	Adelaide Hills				Wicks 2015 Estate Unwooded Chardonnay (Adelaide Hills)	Chardonnay	Wicks	LT_90_Points	This unwooded Chardonnay takes a bit of swirling in the glass before revealing subtle notes of citrus, stone fruit, melon, and blossoms. The palate really perks up with a chalky texture, medium weight and zingy, lemony finish. Crack this one open with poultry or veggies.
58966	Australia		90	20	Western Australia	Mount Barker		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Plantagenet 2011 Riesling (Mount Barker)	Riesling	Plantagenet	GT_90_Points	This impressive offering is crystal-clean and direct, with green apple, lime and petrichor notes that typify Riesling. It's medium bodied and fully dry, with a long, lime-riddled finish. Drink it over the next decade or so.
65337	Australia	Bin 128	88	24	South Australia	Coonawarra		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Penfolds 1999 Bin 128 Shiraz (Coonawarra)	Shiraz	Penfolds	LT_90_Points	Subtle black-pepper notes add an extra layer of complexity to smoke, earth, plum, blackberry and dried spices. This full-bodied, sturdy wine finishes with firm tannins and some lingering coffee notes. Should improve over the next 2 - 3 years. ƒ??J.C.
32298	Australia		88	15	South Australia	Coonawarra		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Nick Faldo 2005 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coonawarra)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Nick Faldo	LT_90_Points	Are golfer-inspired wines the next big thing? First came Greg Norman, then Ernie Els, now there's Nick Faldo. Made by Katnook Estate, this is a dark, plushly textured wine that's immediately accessible. Cassis and plum fruit is framed by dark accents of coffee and cola, picking up hints of mint on the finish. Imported by Freixenet USA.
99103	Australia	Bin 389	89	19	Australia Other	Australia				Penfolds 1998 Bin 389 Cabernet Sauvignon (Australia)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Penfolds	LT_90_Points	Made for almost 40 yearsƒ??since 1962ƒ??this edition of 389 sports lots of spicy American oak, and displays black fruit and tobacco aromas and flavors. The mouthfeel is big, the texture rich and the full, spicy finish is long and tannic. It's drinkable now, but really needs a few years to unwrap a bit, and the oak mantle will probably always be heavy. Satisfying, though somewhat one-dimensional.
3135	Australia		89	17	Western Australia	Margaret River		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Wildberry Estate 2005 Shiraz (Margaret River)	Shiraz	Wildberry Estate	LT_90_Points	Full-bodied and firm, this dark-fruited Shiraz an be consumed now with rare beef or lamb, or cellared 2ƒ??3 years. Cola and blackberry fruit dominate, with notes of chocolate and cedar chiming in on the finish.
128182	Australia		86	90	Victoria	Yarra Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Yeringberg 2013 Red (Yarra Valley)	Bordeaux-style Red Blend	Yeringberg	LT_90_Points	This traditional blend of five Bordeaux varieties comes across as tight and streamlined, lacking much texture or richness. Cedar, cassis and mint finish crisp.
87482	Australia		85	17	Victoria	Yarra Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Sticks 2005 Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)	Pinot Noir	Sticks	LT_90_Points	Comes off as a slightly skinny Pinot Noir, with herbal overtones to the cherry and strawberry flavors. Still, it's varietally true, and light enough in body to pair effectively with chicken or salmon. Drink now.
124513	Australia	Art Series	86	22	Western Australia	Margaret River		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Leeuwin Estate 2010 Art Series Riesling (Margaret River)	Riesling	Leeuwin Estate	LT_90_Points	A bit developed already, with a round mouthfeel and some honey character accented by citrus and gingery-peppery spice. Pleasant to drink now, but seems to lack the vivacity for extended aging.
60899	Australia	William Randell	89	40	South Australia	Barossa Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Thorn Clarke 2008 William Randell Shiraz (Barossa Valley)	Shiraz	Thorn Clarke	LT_90_Points	Shows some of the warmth of the vintage in its elevated alcohol levels and high-toned fruit. It's full-bodied and supple, with flavors of brandied plums and baking spices. Drink it over the next few years.
84575	Australia	Titan	89	29	South Australia	McLaren Vale		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Alpha Crucis 2012 Titan Shiraz (McLaren Vale)	Shiraz	Alpha Crucis	LT_90_Points	This wine's full-bodied nature and chunky-blocky texture matches its name. It's dark and brooding in style, with hints of charred meat, asphalt and black olive. Give it some time. Drink 2018ƒ??2022.
72428	Australia	DB Family Selection	84	9	Australia Other	South Eastern Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	De Bortoli 2010 DB Family Selection Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)	Pinot Grigio	De Bortoli	LT_90_Points	Medium in weight, with modest pear and melon aromas and flavors. It's clean and fresh, finishing with a delicate touch of citrus. Drink now.
74572	Australia		88	16	South Australia	Barossa		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Peter Lehmann 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Barossa)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Peter Lehmann	LT_90_Points	Lehmann's 2006 Barossa Cab is an easy-drinking, crowd-pleasing red that should find its way into many steakhouses as a by-the-glass pour. Minty notes accent cassis and tobacco flavors, while the wine's soft tannins will provide a welcome counterpoint to rich steaks.
104779	Australia		87	10	Australia Other	South Eastern Australia				Yangarra Park 2001 Shiraz (South Eastern Australia)	Shiraz	Yangarra Park	LT_90_Points	This baby has aromas of just-picked ripe plums, boysenberries,and a peppery-chocolatey note that shows up on the palate. It's dry, clean and sharp, and it's a lot of fun. ƒ??S.H.
27096	Australia	Limited Release Calliope	84	40	Victoria	Rutherglen		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	R.L. Buller & Son 2004 Limited Release Calliope Shiraz (Rutherglen)	Shiraz	R.L. Buller & Son	LT_90_Points	This is a tough wine to evaluate. On the one hand, there's plenty of concentration and ripeness, reflected in the wine's high-toned raspberry fruit, ample weight and rich, creamy texture. On the other hand, the alcohol is a bit elevated (16%) and there's almost 1.5% residual sugar, so it's sweet on the finish.
7828	Australia		87	39	Tasmania	Tasmania		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Stefano Lubiana 1999 Pinot Noir (Tasmania)	Pinot Noir	Stefano Lubiana	LT_90_Points	Smells like Pinot, combining leather, smoke and tart cherry aromas. In the mouth, this light-to-medium-weight wine doesn't show a lot of fruity flavors, but rather leather, dried spices and dusty notes. Juicy cherries gradually emerge on the finish.
123147	Australia	Steeple Jack	84	7	South Australia	South Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Ballast Stone Estate Wines 2006 Steeple Jack Merlot (South Australia)	Merlot	Ballast Stone Estate Wines	LT_90_Points	For the price, this is a commendable effort, with scents of toast and vanilla layered over modest cherry fruit. The wine is medium bodied and marked by the a fine, soft texture, then finishes on a tart note.
49011	Australia	Mountain Estate	89	14	New South Wales	New South Wales		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Inkberry 2013 Mountain Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (New South Wales)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Inkberry	LT_90_Points	This medium-bodied Cabernet offers a balanced blend of earth and mixed berries. Some dusty tannins are present, but come across as fine in texture, suitably framing the long, crisp finish. Drink nowƒ??2020.
89448	Australia	Yakka	90	25	South Australia	Adelaide Hills		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Longview 2007 Yakka Shiraz (Adelaide Hills)	Shiraz	Longview	GT_90_Points	Not a typically fruit-driven Shiraz, Longview's 2007 Yakka boasts pungent scents of smoke, leather and marinated beef, then delivers earthy, meaty flavors. It's full in the mouth, with a creamy texture that turns chewier on the finishƒ??perfect alongside rare beef or lamb. Drink now-2018.
125270	Australia	Coonawarra Estate Terra Rossa	88	30	South Australia	Coonawarra		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Parker 2008 Coonawarra Estate Terra Rossa Cabernet Sauvignon (Coonawarra)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Parker	LT_90_Points	A solid example of Coonawarra Cabernet, the 2008 Terra Rossa features a charming combination of cherry-cassis fruit and eucalypt with cigar box and vanilla. It's medium to full in body, with fine balance and a long finish. Drink nowƒ??2016.
67050	Australia	The Absconder	87	65	South Australia	McLaren Vale		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Wirra Wirra 2014 The Absconder Grenache (McLaren Vale)	Grenache	Wirra Wirra	LT_90_Points	Crisp and edgy, featuring tart cherry fruit and hints of green peppercorn. It's fairly big in the mouth, but lacks a bit of generosity.
116883	Australia	Mort's Reserve Watervale	91	35	South Australia	Clare Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Kilikanoon 2011 Mort's Reserve Watervale Riesling (Clare Valley)	Riesling	Kilikanoon	GT_90_Points	Lean and tightly focused, this looks like one for the cellarƒ??try it around 2018 if you can wait. Right now, it shows modest, restrained citrus fruit, hints of wet stone and a wickedly long, sinewy finish.
19193	Australia	Killerman's Run	91	20	South Australia	South Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Kilikanoon 2005 Killerman's Run Shiraz (South Australia)	Shiraz	Kilikanoon	GT_90_Points	This medium- to full-bodied wine manages to be mouthfilling and round without being excessively soft or syrupy. A savory, meaty, coffee-like note complements the ripe blackberry fruit, which persists a good long time on the finish. Drink nowƒ??2015.
28126	Australia	Aeolia	90	100	Victoria	Victoria		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Giaconda 2005 Aeolia Roussanne (Victoria)	Roussanne	Giaconda	GT_90_Points	A full-bodied, mouthfilling wine, Giaconda's 2005 Aeolia Roussanne showcases aromas of toasted cashews, then balances them against bold peach and citrus fruit. The oak lends a slightly charred quality to the wine, which comes through on the finish as a hint of espresso. Drink now and over the next few years.
24195	Australia		87	17	Victoria	Yarra Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Sticks 2004 Cabernet Sauvignon (Yarra Valley)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Sticks	LT_90_Points	Nicely balanced, this is the sort of restrained Cab Sauvignon Yarra Valley can do well, with hints of mint and eucalyptus layered over cassis fruit. The texture is creamy, the tannins smooth. It's not as rich as the 2003, or a barrel sample of the 2006, but it's well crafted and harmonious.
116353	Australia	Polish Hill River	85		South Australia	Clare Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Pauletts 2010 Polish Hill River Riesling (Clare Valley)	Riesling	Pauletts	LT_90_Points	Has typical Clare Valley Riesling elements of crushed stone and citrus, but also considerable petrol and hints of honey and ripe apple. It's medium-bodied and tart, with a metallic or slightly pithy note on the finish.
28347	Australia		89	25	Victoria	Bendigo		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Balgownie Estate 2013 Shiraz (Bendigo)	Shiraz	Balgownie Estate	LT_90_Points	Tannic and extracted, with gritty tannins and dark, almost dried fruit. This is powerful stuff, framed by hints of brown sugar and baking spices. Try pairing it against char-grilled steak or lamb.
38094	Australia		89	16	Western Australia	Margaret River		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Cape Mentelle 2012 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)	Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon	Cape Mentelle	LT_90_Points	This wine shows an intriguing touch of flinty, fum?? character as well as ample melon and fig fruit. It's reasonably full bodied and textured for a wine of its ilk.
58660	Australia		89	22	South Australia	Adelaide Hills		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Shaw and Smith 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)	Sauvignon Blanc	Shaw and Smith	LT_90_Points	In line with the winery style, this is lean and tight on the palate, a bit of a citrus laser blending lime and grapefruit. Try it with raw seafood dishes, like a fluke carpaccio or ceviche.
83270	Australia	Red Silk	88	20	South Australia	McLaren Vale		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Oliverhill 2013 Red Silk Shiraz (McLaren Vale)	Shiraz	Oliverhill	LT_90_Points	Full bodied, supple and warm, this is a ripe Shiraz loaded with dark plum, cola and earth flavors. The finish turns spicy, with a slightly grainy tannin structure.
40942	Australia	Brut	82	11	Australia Other	Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Silverwing NV Brut  (Australia)	Champagne Blend	Silverwing	LT_90_Points	Broad in the mouth and on the sweet side, this Chardonnay-Pinot Noir blend does offer some attractive gingery notes on the nose, while the flavors favor baked apples.
49162	Australia		86	14	South Australia	McLaren Vale				Tatachilla 2000 Chardonnay (McLaren Vale)	Chardonnay	Tatachilla	LT_90_Points	A bright, sunny, yellow Chard through and through-and the cream-and-tropcial fruit nose is just the beginning. Peach, banana and vanilla flavors resurface on the palate; toasty-butterscotch flavors round out the back end. An instant mood-lifter. Drink now.
2958	Australia		86	37	South Australia	Clare Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Pearson Vineyards 2005 Cabernet Sauvignon (Clare Valley)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Pearson Vineyards	LT_90_Points	This is a perfectly fine example of Clare Valley Cabernet, one that emphasizes refinement and elegance over sheer power and intensity. Cassis, tobacco and a hint of vanilla account for the bulk of the aromatic and flavor interest, and it turns mouthwatering on the finish. Should hold well through 2015.
43367	Australia	The Derelict Vineyard	91	29	South Australia	McLaren Vale		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	D'Arenberg 2013 The Derelict Vineyard Grenache (McLaren Vale)	Grenache	D'Arenberg	GT_90_Points	The d'Arenberg style favors structure over plushness, even in Grenache. This is crisp and firm, its cranberryish fruit tinged with hints of raspberry, orange zest, cinnamon and clove. Give it a few years to soften. Drink 2020ƒ??2030.
74854	Australia	Clarendon	90	45	South Australia	Clarendon		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Clarendon Hills 2007 Clarendon Grenache (Clarendon)	Grenache	Clarendon Hills	GT_90_Points	The 2007 Clarendon is in a more feminine, approachable style than Roman Bratasiuk's other 2007 Grenaches, featuring dried spices, watermelon and cherry aromas and fineƒ??almost delicateƒ??tannins. Cherry-berry flavors finish with hints of cinnamon and clove. Drink nowƒ??2015.
2594	Australia	The Ripper	90	20	Western Australia	Geographe		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Hope Estate 2010 The Ripper Shiraz (Geographe)	Shiraz	Hope Estate	GT_90_Points	Made in a superripe, dense, almost fudge-like style, The Ripper tastes like a plummy, chocolaty Christmas cake with slightly coarse tannins on the finish. It's Port-like in flavor, but without the heat from elevated alcohol. Drink it over the next few years.
11551	Australia	Benno Shiraz-Mataro	92	75	South Australia	Barossa Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Murray Street 2004 Benno Shiraz-Mataro Red (Barossa Valley)	Red Blend	Murray Street	GT_90_Points	The flagship wine from a relatively new Barossa producer, the 2004 Benno features smoky, savory, spice- and meat-driven aromas that easily move into complex and well-integrated flavors of spice and dark berries. Despite its labeled 15% alcohol, the wine isn't heavy, instead offering medium body and a creamy smooth texture. Finishes long, with lingering dark fruit flavors. Drink nowƒ??2020.
113809	Australia		90	35	Victoria	Heathcote		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Taltarni 2005 Shiraz (Heathcote)	Shiraz	Taltarni	GT_90_Points	Well done Shiraz, carefully made and judiciously oaked, with vanilla and cedar accenting blackberry, plum and black olive flavors. It's moderately tannic on the finish, where it adds some coffee-like nuances as well. Drink 2010ƒ??2018.
6662	Australia		90	21	Victoria	Yarra Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Sticks 2008 Chardonnay (Yarra Valley)	Chardonnay	Sticks	GT_90_Points	Consumers are reaping the benefit of Australia's Chardonnay grape glut. This elegant, refined, cool-climate Chardonnay comes at a bargain price for its flavors of lightly grilled pineapple, melon, citrus and hazelnut. Drink nowƒ??2012.
115832	Australia	Bin 407	91	69	South Australia	South Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Penfolds 2014 Bin 407 Cabernet Sauvignon (South Australia)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Penfolds	GT_90_Points	This is almost confectionery in its fruit sweetness, layering raspberries over black currants in wave after wave. There's a hint of mint as well, ample weight and power on the palate and a long, dusty, tannic finish. Drink nowƒ??2030.
127766	Australia	Lot 147	91	26	South Australia	Barossa Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Rocland Estate 2006 Lot 147 Shiraz (Barossa Valley)	Shiraz	Rocland Estate	GT_90_Points	Rocland puts out a number of inexpensive wines, but this is evidence that the company has quality aspirations as well. Filled with plum, blueberry, licorice and dried-spice notes, this is a reasonably full-bodied wine with a long, dusty finish that would pair nicely with steaks or roasts. Drink nowƒ??2018.
91957	Australia		84	12	South Australia	McLaren Vale				Razor's Edge 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Razor's Edge	LT_90_Points	Black ash, cedar and crushed raspberries are the aromas here, while an underlying note of wet earth keeps things grounded. The palate has a sweet cherry cordial character while the short finish offers up a hit of mixed berry soup. Drink up.
7932	Australia	The Strapper Grenache-Shiraz-Mataro	90	19	South Australia	Barossa		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Yalumba 2012 The Strapper Grenache-Shiraz-Mataro G-S-M (Barossa)	G-S-M	Yalumba	GT_90_Points	Despite a reported alcohol level that's moderate for its genre, this feels nicely full and rounded on the palate. Hints of vanilla and sarsaparilla accent flavors of cherries, plums and chocolate, while the tannins are supple and creamy in texture. Drink nowƒ??2018.
73016	Australia	Reserve	90	18	South Australia	Coonawarra		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Criterion 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Coonawarra)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Criterion	GT_90_Points	Criterion is a so-called global brand, offering Italian Pinot Grigio, Rioja and Chianti Classico among other benchmarks. This Coonawarra Cabernet is surprisingly good given that background. It offers cherry, cassis and tobacco notes, medium body and silky tannins. Drink it over the next 5ƒ??8 years.

paragraphs.title: Compare Wines from Different Countries
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Compare wines from Different Countries
-- Hint: Choose different countries from the drop down

SELECT * FROM WineReviews130K_bin WHERE COUNTRY = ${COUNTRY='Germany', 'Germany'|'Spain'|'Chile'|'US'|'Argentine'|'Italy'|'Australia'};

msg.data:
ID	COUNTRY	DESIGNATION	POINTS	PRICE	PROVINCE	REGION_1	REGION_2	TASTER_NAME	TASTER_TWITTER_HANDLE	TITLE	VARIETY	WINERY	POINTS_BIN	DESCRIPTION
31861	US	Susan's Hill Vineyard	86	34	California	Santa Lucia Highlands	Central Coast			Novy 2010 Susan's Hill Vineyard Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)	Syrah	Novy	LT_90_Points	Tastes unusual soft and melted for a Santa Lucia Highlands Syrah, but the blackberry, licorice, cola and sweet oak flavors sure are delicious. The absence of structure makes the wine finish  quick, and will not allow it to age, so drink up.
109099	US		88	22	Oregon	Willamette Valley	Willamette Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Adelsheim 2012 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)	Chardonnay	Adelsheim	LT_90_Points	Light and lively, this is a bright, tangy, fruit-driven effort, with little or no evident barrel flavor. Apples and white peaches hold down the center, with a crisp, fresh finish.
81496	US	H3	88	15	Washington	Horse Heaven Hills	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	Columbia Crest 2015 H3 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)	Merlot	Columbia Crest	LT_90_Points	Aromas of plum and blue fruit are accented by high-toned spices and milk chocolate. Flavors are soft, palate coating and poised, with blue-fruit flavors lingering on the finish. It doesn't necessarily taste like Merlot but still brings plenty of appeal.
55151	US		87	27	New York	North Fork of Long Island	Long Island	Anna Lee C. Iijima		Martha Clara 2014 Malbec-Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)	Malbec-Merlot	Martha Clara	LT_90_Points	Fleshy black plums accented with nuts, vanilla and popcorn scent this voluptuously textured red. It's ruddy and ripe, but tinged by a hint of green on the midpalate. Bright red-currant acidity and fine slightly tacky tannins frame the finish. Drink now through 2020.
57951	US	Guadalupe Vineyard	87	15	Oregon	Oregon	Oregon Other	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Siltstone 2014 Guadalupe Vineyard Pinot Gris (Oregon)	Pinot Gris	Siltstone	LT_90_Points	Classic varietal aromas of pear flesh and skin open into just slightly underripe fruit flavors. The wine is balanced and adds tart apple to the pear fruit.

It's classic Dry Creek Zin in a drink-me-now way. Dry, medium-bodied and gentle in tannins, it features lip-smacking flavors of pepper, red currants, tobacco and anise.
55293	US	Super Nero	86	30	Texas	Texas		Alexander Peartree		Brennan 2012 Super Nero Nero d'Avola (Texas)	Nero d'Avola	Brennan	LT_90_Points	Bing cherry meets soft vanilla and coffee tones on the nose of this southern-Italian transplant. A bouncy palate of red cherry and strawberry is supported by mild tannins.
22025	US		86	30	Oregon	Rogue Valley	Southern Oregon	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	South Stage 2012 Syrah (Rogue Valley)	Syrah	South Stage	LT_90_Points	Rather grapey, front-loaded flavors move quickly into a subdued midpalate, with muted notes of ash and licorice. The wine seems a bit thin given its fairly high alcohol.
108021	US	Ceja Vineyard	85	40	California	Carneros	Napa-Sonoma			Olabisi 2011 Ceja Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)	Chardonnay	Olabisi	LT_90_Points	The oak overpowers the limes and mangoes. Despite mouthwatering acidity, the wine is dominated by butterscotch and buttered cinnamon toast.
23904	US		85	15	California	Central Coast	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Sand Dollar 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Sand Dollar	LT_90_Points	Bell-pepper scents are cut by cracked pepper and blackberry on the nose of this bottling. The mouthfeel is soft, with black cherry and plum-juice flavors enhanced by peppery spices.
39998	US		87	28	Oregon	Willamette Valley	Willamette Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Copper Belt 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)	Pinot Noir	Copper Belt	LT_90_Points	The winery is in eastern Oregon, near the Idaho border, but the grapes were sourced from an unnamed Willamette Valley vineyard. A bit high-toned, with sharply defined strawberry and cherry fruit, this finishes with a burst of caramel and mocha.
82295	US		85	13	New York	Finger Lakes	Finger Lakes	Anna Lee C. Iijima		Lakewood 2011 Riesling (Finger Lakes)	Riesling	Lakewood	LT_90_Points	While quite earthy and smoky on the nose, this off-dry Riesling is pleasantly fruity on the palate showing fresh apple and lemon flavors accented with vibrant lime acidity. The finish is brisk with some astringency.
123144	US		84	16	California	High Valley				Two Angels 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (High Valley)	Sauvignon Blanc	Two Angels	LT_90_Points	A bit strong in those infamous feline aromas and tastes, but okay in crisp, dry citrus and lemongrass flavors. Give it a good decant before serving.
5921	US	Sonas	88	25	Washington	Yakima Valley	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	OS Winery 2013 Sonas Merlot (Yakima Valley)	Merlot	OS Winery	LT_90_Points	High-toned aromas of raspberries, mint, nori and green herbs are followed by black-tea flavors and slightly gritty-feeling tannins. It brings appeal but the variety seems hard to find.
125547	US		88	45	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	William Church 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))	Cabernet Sauvignon	William Church	LT_90_Points	Aromas of blackberry, herb, black cherry and spice box are followed by medium-bodied black-cherry flavors. Lightly grainy tannins provide support.
2628	US		82	13	Oregon	Willamette Valley	Willamette Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Emerson 2006 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)	Pinot Gris	Emerson	LT_90_Points	This is Pinot Gris without any particular varietal character; it could be almost anything. It's got tart, lemon-flavored fruit and a thin, watery finish.
2771	US	Reserve	84	20	California	Russian River Valley	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Frei Brothers 2014 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)	Chardonnay	Frei Brothers	LT_90_Points	This is a simple representation of the variety: medium in acidity and weight and a roundness of appropriate apple and pear that finishes flat.
88149	US		86	30	California	Sonoma Coast	Sonoma			Siduri 2007 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)	Pinot Noir	Siduri	LT_90_Points	Soft and direct, this Pinot Noir offers easy flavors of cherries, currants, cola and spice, wrapped into a silky texture. Drink now.
3041	US	Traditions Evergreen Vineyard	88	13	Washington	Ancient Lakes	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	Milbrandt 2015 Traditions Evergreen Vineyard Riesling (Ancient Lakes)	Riesling	Milbrandt	LT_90_Points	Aromas of mineral, flowers and freshly cut green apple are followed by a just off-dry, lightly spritzy palate full of stone-fruit flavors.
87955	US	Old Vine Meriwether Vineyard	84	25	Virginia	Virginia		Alexander Peartree		Pearmund 2013 Old Vine Meriwether Vineyard Chardonnay (Virginia)	Chardonnay	Pearmund	LT_90_Points	Muddled citrus and a drizzle of artificial butter initially marks the nose and palate. Additional notes of bitter lemon peel and roasted pear carry the flavors to a slightly astringent finish.
88503	US		88	28	California	Amador County	Sierra Foothills	Jim Gordon	@gordone_cellars	Deaver 2012 Zinfandel (Amador County)	Zinfandel	Deaver	LT_90_Points	This very ripe and full-bodied wine has aromas like vanilla and baking spices, sweet cherry flavors and a smooth and rounded texture. A luscious cherry-pie impression lingers on the finish.
88267	US		88	28	California	Knights Valley	Sonoma			Ehret 2007 Syrah (Knights Valley)	Syrah	Ehret	LT_90_Points	Quite a good Syrah, although it's a little too soft, so open it now because it won't hold for too long. It's dry and silky smooth in the mouth, with rich, ripe blackberry, blueberry, chocolate, bacon and pepper flavors.
36852	US		86	32	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Pomum 2007 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))	Syrah	Pomum	LT_90_Points	A serviceable Syrah, with somewhat muted blueberry and huckleberry fruit, pepper and herb. Medium concentration, with more of the herbal and stem flavors coming through in the tannins.
97777	US		88	22	Virginia	Virginia		Alexander Peartree		Early Mountain 2014 Ros?? (Virginia)	Ros??	Early Mountain	LT_90_Points	This is an upfront and vibrant ros??, showing ample stone fruit and watermelon aromas on the nose. Predominately Merlot, it offers a round and fleshy palate, balanced by a lively vein of lemon. These lead to a juicy peach and jasmine tea finish.
94016	US		85	23	Virginia	Virginia		Alexander Peartree		Stinson 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)	Sauvignon Blanc	Stinson	LT_90_Points	Lively fresh-cut grass and gooseberry notes pervade on the nose and carry to the light-bodied, citrus-driven palate. A clean, flinty note offers some nuance on the brisk finish.
84543	US		88	28	California	El Dorado	Sierra Foothills	Jim Gordon	@gordone_cellars	Everhart Cellars 2014 Petite Sirah (El Dorado)	Petite Sirah	Everhart Cellars	LT_90_Points	Big but well balanced, this full-bodied wine has been tamed a bit by two-and-a-half years of aging, but it still has the typical firm tannins that cling to the sides of the mouth. Accents of cedar and earth accompany the tasty blackberry core of flavor.
18284	US	Rockstar	88	28	California	Monterey County	Central Coast			Chateau Lettau 2007 Rockstar Red (Monterey County)	Red Blend	Chateau Lettau	LT_90_Points	A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petite Sirah, this has firm tannins and ripe, forward flavors of blackberries, currants and oak. Already throwing some sediment, it will continue to soften and mellow over the next 5ƒ??6 years.
122224	US		88	30	California	Sonoma County	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Reaper 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)	Pinot Noir	Reaper	LT_90_Points	Blades of spearmint and cardamom are prominent on the nose of this wine, followed by a palate rich in pine and black cherry. Lithe with a dense ripeness, the finish is prickly in Asian spice.
71575	US		88	15	California	Dry Creek Valley	Sonoma			Chelsea Goldschmidt 2009 Merlot (Dry Creek Valley)	Merlot	Chelsea Goldschmidt	LT_90_Points	Great price on a Merlot this good. Most others would charge $25 or more, but Goldschmidt has held the line. It appeals for the soft tannins and easy flavors of raspberries, cherries, cocoa and sweet, smoky oak. Drink now.
66369	US		88	30	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	Browne Family Vineyards 2013 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))	Chardonnay	Browne Family Vineyards	LT_90_Points	Hailing from Sagemoor, Oasis and Canyon Vineyard Ranch, this wine has aromas of toasty spices, peach, butter and corn on the cob. The flavors are lighter in style with a creamy feel and a pleasing sense of balance.
75792	US		85	70	California	Napa Valley	Napa			Shadowbox 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Shadowbox	LT_90_Points	This feels sharp and raw, with ripe, jammy blackberry and cherry flavors, plus a streak of sweet, toasty oak. Drink now.
106772	US	Oakenshield Vineyard	88	30	California	Paso Robles	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Castoro Cellars 2015 Oakenshield Vineyard Falanghina (Paso Robles)	Falanghina	Castoro Cellars	LT_90_Points	Golden-yellow in color, this bottling of a rarely planted grape from Italy's Campania region shows soft chamomile and sliced yellow apples on the pleasant nose. Squeezed lemon, light mandarin juice and a touch of walnut oil show on the sip, where the acid rises late and lasts long.
105927	US		83	25	Washington	Walla Walla Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Sweet Valley 2007 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))	Merlot	Sweet Valley	LT_90_Points	Some wines can hit 15.4% alcohol, as this does, and make it work. But here the burn and scorch from the alcohol simply overwhelms some excellent fruit. Detail is lost, and what's left is a hot, jammy red.
26617	US	Rosella's Vineyard	89	48	California	Santa Lucia Highlands	Central Coast			Siduri 2009 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)	Pinot Noir	Siduri	LT_90_Points	Flashy, jammy raspberry and cherry fruit marks this vibrant Pinot Noir. It's just yummy, and made bright and clean with zingy acidity. Seems best now for its sheer youthful razzle dazzle, so drink up.
35643	US	Barlow Vineyards	88	52	California	Calistoga	Napa	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Laura Michael 2012 Barlow Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Laura Michael	LT_90_Points	Grippy with tar notes and tannin, this full-bodied wine offers ripe blackberry, currant and licorice highlights before giving in to its richness with dark chocolate renderings.
31871	US		87	10	California	North Coast	North Coast	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Line 39 2010 Petite Sirah (North Coast)	Petite Sirah	Line 39	LT_90_Points	A delightfully easy-drinking Petite Sirah with cherry fruit and licorice overriding a subtle note of tobacco. Drink now.
31326	US	Reserve	87	55	California	Russian River Valley	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Ideology 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)	Pinot Noir	Ideology	LT_90_Points	Made in tiny quantities, this reserve-tier wine is smoky and robust in black cherry and vanilla flavors, supported by a density of oak.
55842	US	Steelhead Run Vineyard Blessed	87	23	Oregon	Rogue Valley	Southern Oregon	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Schultz 2012 Steelhead Run Vineyard Blessed Merlot (Rogue Valley)	Merlot	Schultz	LT_90_Points	This full-bodied wine shows smooth and rounded plum fruit. The flavors are mouth-filling, but the rather quick fade suggests it's best consumed in the near term, as it's already five years past harvest.
79858	US		84	17	California	Napa Valley	Napa			Educated Guess 2011 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)	Chardonnay	Educated Guess	LT_90_Points	There's vibrant acidity and underlying flavors of pineapple, white peach and mango in this Chardonnay. The overall palate, however, is overwhelmed by oak.
58943	US		88	35	Oregon	Rogue Valley	Southern Oregon	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Ledger David 2012 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)	Tempranillo	Ledger David	LT_90_Points	Cranberries, raspberries and black cherries are in the fruit bowl here, with a hint of wet hay. Still sharp and spicy, it's astringent and offers a light hint of dried tobacco. As with many of the winery's reds, the basic material is excellent, and shows great potential as the vines mature.
24638	US	Maldonado Vineyard Dijon Clones	87	39	California	Napa Valley	Napa			Venge 2009 Maldonado Vineyard Dijon Clones Chardonnay (Napa Valley)	Chardonnay	Venge	LT_90_Points	Loads of pineapple jam and roasted peach flavors in this rich, oaky Chardonnay. Nothing shy about its fruity power, with rich vanilla and caramel oak barrel influences. Could use greater complexity and nuance.
103331	US	Pomar Junction Vineyard	82	34	California	Monterey	Central Coast			Pomar Junction 2008 Pomar Junction Vineyard Zinfandel (Monterey)	Zinfandel	Pomar Junction	LT_90_Points	Simple and sweet, with raspberry, cherry and mint candy flavors. Drink now.
58347	US	Inked	86	54	Arizona	Arizona				Sultry Cellars 2010 Inked Red (Arizona)	Red Blend	Sultry Cellars	LT_90_Points	Pressed flowers, undergrowth and blood orange lead to a lithe, medium-weight palate that comes with juicy acidity. The finish features hints of desiccated black fruit and clover honey.
91291	US	Estate Grown	85	30	New York	North Fork of Long Island	Long Island	Anna Lee C. Iijima		Sherwood House Vineyards 2011 Estate Grown Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)	Chardonnay	Sherwood House Vineyards	LT_90_Points	While a tad savory on the nose with aromas of pressed apples and pears, this full-bodied Chardonnay boasts brisk lemony acidity and a straightforward, fresh apple appeal. It finishes briskly, with a hint of honeyed tea.
52297	US	Roll Ranch Vineyard	87	24	California	California	California Other			Ojai 2010 Roll Ranch Vineyard Viognier (California)	Viognier	Ojai	LT_90_Points	Made in a leaner, racier style than most California Viogniers, this has mineral, tangerine and apricot flavors, with considerable acidity.
105206	US	Home Ranch	82	9	California	California	California Other			Fetzer 1997 Home Ranch Zinfandel (California)	Zinfandel	Fetzer	LT_90_Points	Ripe, briary aromas of wild berries, plums and earth veer into dark chocolate. Flavors are on the light side, and seem a little soft. An affordable everyday wine to serve at picnics. Donƒ??t be misled by the ƒ??Home Ranchƒ?� description; this is not an estate wine.
20270	US	Mello Vineyard	88	32	California	Yountville	Napa	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Tamber Bey 2014 Mello Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)	Sauvignon Blanc	Tamber Bey	LT_90_Points	Full and weighty, this vineyard-designate is salty and floral, offering whiffs of orange blossom around lime zest and brine. The minerality shines through despite the size, making for a food-friendly, yet hedonistic wine.
102343	US		88	15	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	Three Rivers 2014 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))	Riesling	Three Rivers	LT_90_Points	All the fruit for this wine comes from Bacchus Vineyard. Aromas of jasmine, honeysuckle and apricot lead to medium-sweet stone-fruit flavors that linger.
124651	US	Flume Crossing	89	14	California	Arroyo Seco	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	J. Lohr 2014 Flume Crossing Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)	Sauvignon Blanc	J. Lohr	LT_90_Points	For those who want classically grassy and energetic Sauv Blanc flavors, this widely available bottling is perfect. Aromas of both boisterously tropical fruit and funky cut grass lead into a zingy palate of white pepper, bell pepper, cement and lime.
67235	US	Proprietor's Reserve	87	43	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	Maryhill 2014 Proprietor's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))	Cabernet Sauvignon	Maryhill	LT_90_Points	As a 100% varietal wine, blue fruit, vanilla and herb aromas are followed by abundant cherry flavors, with lightly dry tannins backing them up. The oak plays a prominent role.
44722	US	Tondre H Block	88	65	California	Santa Lucia Highlands	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Tantara 2012 Tondre H Block Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)	Pinot Noir	Tantara	LT_90_Points	Pomegranate, sour cherry, cranberry and slight anise emerge with patience on the shy nose. The flavors are also light, with cranberry sauce, brown spices, a touch of pepper and an herbal finish.
58572	US		85	18	California	Mendocino County				Zina Hyde Cunningham 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)	Sauvignon Blanc	Zina Hyde Cunningham	LT_90_Points	With its slightly sweet notes of pineapple pie, dates and vanilla, this zesty Sauvignon Blanc is nice to sip as a cocktail. It will also pair well with a smoky ham sandwich with Dijon mustard.
95576	US	Garys' Vineyard	87	59	California	Santa Lucia Highlands	Central Coast			Testarossa 2007 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)	Pinot Noir	Testarossa	LT_90_Points	Released at less than one year of age, this wine is immature, almost a barrel sample. It's vibrant in cherries, milk chocolate and new oak, but disjointed. Needs time. Give it until late 2009 to come together.
88269	US	Wild Z	88	20	Oregon	Walla Walla Valley (OR)	Oregon Other	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Zerba Cellars 2007 Wild Z Red (Walla Walla Valley (OR))	Red Blend	Zerba Cellars	LT_90_Points	Zerba's crowd-pleasing Wild Z blends Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah about equally, with a splash of Cabernet Franc to finish it off. It's a ripe, full, forward, chocolaty mouthful. It keeps the red fruit tart and tantalizing, while loading in the barrel flavors (French and American) to round off the finish. A fine follow-up to the excellent 2006.
38565	US	Lia's Vineyard	87	25	Oregon	Chehalem Mountains	Willamette Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Daedalus Cellars 2006 Lia's Vineyard Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)	Chardonnay	Daedalus Cellars	LT_90_Points	This is the first Chardonnay for Daedalus Cellars. Flavors are rich and full-bodied, with candied orange peel, sweet citrus and vanilla most noticeable among them. Left on the lees for almost 18 months, this is wide open and ready to drink.
8008	US		87	40	California	Russian River Valley	Sonoma			Lynmar 2008 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)	Pinot Noir	Lynmar	LT_90_Points	A little green and minty, with some stalky flavors, but dry and vibrant in acidity. Offers good cherry and raspberry pie flavors that are wrapped into a silky texture, with beautiful tannins. Drink now.
114800	US		88	17	California	Dry Creek Valley	Sonoma			Mauritson 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)	Sauvignon Blanc	Mauritson	LT_90_Points	This is an unoaked Sauvignon Blanc but you won't miss the wood at all because it's so delicious. Shows waves of vanilla-scented lemongrass, pineapples and even richer golden mango. All this is accented with lively acidity, and the finish is honeyed. A lovely cocktail sipper or with savory little appetizers.
123465	US	Vixen Red Wine	91	45	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Sinclair Estate Vineyards 2007 Vixen Red Wine Red (Columbia Valley (WA))	Red Blend	Sinclair Estate Vineyards	GT_90_Points	This captivating wine treads the line between Rh??ne and Bordeaux. A splash of Cabernet, though just a fraction of the blend, stands out. The wine has depth and persistence, and the mix of grapes works well, showing brambly red fruits, like a Zin, spice and pepper, like Syrah, and some herbal and leafy tobacco in the finish. Complex, unique and quite appealing.
25003	US		93	56	California	Sonoma-Napa	Napa-Sonoma			Pride Mountain 2006 Merlot (Sonoma-Napa)	Merlot	Pride Mountain	GT_90_Points	Made in the Pride style, this is a big, powerful wine that should age well. It's enormously ripe, with flamboyant cassis, cherry pie filling, milk chocolate, licorice and smoky oak flavors that are wrapped into thoroughly modern, softly refined tannins. Just beautiful, and should develop through 2012.
112800	US	Keefer Ranch	94	45	California	Russian River Valley	Sonoma			Failla 2006 Keefer Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)	Pinot Noir	Failla	GT_90_Points	Failla has a great track record with this vineyard, which is source to many wineries. The '06 is fresh and vibrant, and needs a little time to develop. It shows classic balance, with rich tannins, crisp acidity and brilliantly ripe, oak-inspired flavors of cherries, black raspberries, cola and currants. As delicious as it is now, it's nervous and tentative. Give it a few years to come around.
44831	US	Christine Lorraine Vineyard	86	25	Oregon	Oregon	Oregon Other	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine?ÿ	Gypsy Dancer 2006 Christine Lorraine Vineyard Pinot Gris (Oregon)	Pinot Gris	Gypsy Dancer	LT_90_Points	Honeysuckle scents and flavors of pear, papaya and cucumber lead into a fresh and delicate wine, with plenty of acid behind the crisp fruit.

paragraphs.title: Compare Wines from Different Countries
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Compare wines from Different Countries
-- Hint: Choose different countries from the drop down

SELECT * FROM WineReviews130K_bin WHERE COUNTRY = ${COUNTRY='Germany', 'Germany'|'Spain'|'Chile'|'US'|'Argentine'|'Italy'|'Australia'};

msg.data:
ID	COUNTRY	DESIGNATION	POINTS	PRICE	PROVINCE	REGION_1	REGION_2	TASTER_NAME	TASTER_TWITTER_HANDLE	TITLE	VARIETY	WINERY	POINTS_BIN	DESCRIPTION
74674	Spain	II Crianza	87	15	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Covila 2011 II Crianza  (Rioja)	Tempranillo	Covila	LT_90_Points	Aromas of brick dust, cheesy oak and black fruits battle to maintain clarity as this breathes. A sinewy mouthfeel is steered by high tartaric acidity, while flavors of vanilla, lactic oak, plum and currant are fresh and a bit tart. A medium-bodied, oaky tasting finish is driven by zesty acidity.
97832	Spain	Crianza	83	15	Northern Spain	Ribera del Duero		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Catania 2007 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)	Tempranillo	Catania	LT_90_Points	Earthy, leafy and also damp smelling, with a raisiny quotient. The palate is heavy, with muddled, murky, damp-tasting berry fruit. Peppery and fairly dull on the finish, with a thick, meaty feel.
27293	Spain	Lo Mon	88	38	Catalonia	Priorat		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Trossos del Priorat 2010 Lo Mon Red (Priorat)	Red Blend	Trossos del Priorat	LT_90_Points	Jammy but generic berry fruit aromas are crowded by lactic, pasty oak scents and vanilla. The wine is hard as cement in the mouth, with jagged tannins. Flavors of sun-baked raisin and plum fold in chocolate and rubbery notes on a grabby finish that includes residual resiny oak. This could use more time; try after 2016.
120739	Spain	El Circo Volatinero	86	8	Northern Spain	Cari?ñena		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Grandes Vinos y Vi?ñedos 2015 El Circo Volatinero Tempranillo (Cari?ñena)	Tempranillo	Grandes Vinos y Vi?ñedos	LT_90_Points	Earthy gritty berry aromas come with a hint of animal. This is juicy and in good shape across the palate, while bright plum and berry flavors are dusted with spice and chocolate notes. A wiry finish with lightly medicinal berry flavors shows kick.
69411	Spain		87	12	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Vi?ña Egu??a 2014 Rosado (Rioja)	Rosado	Vi?ña Egu??a	LT_90_Points	Zesty cherry aromas are offset by powdery softness and floral hints. This feels solid and correct, with bright acidity. Flavors of red-apple skins and citrus fruits finish direct and clean.
59065	Spain		84	20	Northern Spain	Bierzo		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Peique 2013 Godello (Bierzo)	Godello	Peique	LT_90_Points	Pithy citrus aromas are heavy and strangely herbal for a white wine. Pulpy and wide in feel, with little midpalate structure, this tastes of citrus rind, white grapefruit and nopal. A zesty note reprises on the finish.
51524	Spain	Sentido	86	28	Northern Spain	Ribera del Duero		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Neo 2007 Sentido  (Ribera del Duero)	Tempranillo	Neo	LT_90_Points	Floral, spicy, semi-oaky aromas precede a tangy, fresh, higher-acid palate with snappy raspberry and red cherry flavors. There's an abundance of pop and snap to this medium-bodied wine, and then drying woody notes to the finish.
47619	Spain	Laya Old Vines	87	9	Central Spain	Almansa		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Atalaya 2010 Laya Old Vines Garnacha-Monastrell (Almansa)	Garnacha-Monastrell	Atalaya	LT_90_Points	Leather, plum and berry aromas form a nice opening as minty chocolate notes emerge. It feels spunky, with edgy, rubbery tannins and full flavors of plum, cherry, mint and herb. Dry and controlled on the finish, this has an overall fresh character. Mostly Garnacha with some Monastrell.
94670	Spain	3	87	15	Northern Spain	Cari?ñena		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Gabarda NV 3 Red (Cari?ñena)	Red Blend	Gabarda	LT_90_Points	Fleshy cherry and lightly green, herbal aromas lead to a crisp, tight palate. This tastes a little leafy and herbal, with raspberry notes. The finish is fresh, dry, and composed, but not overly intense or focused.
10187	Spain	Spiga	87	31	Northern Spain	Ribera del Duero		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	O. Fournier 2008 Spiga  (Ribera del Duero)	Tinto del Pais	O. Fournier	LT_90_Points	Tight and gritty on the bouquet, with licorice and herbal aromas. Comes across hard and tannic in the mouth, with blackberry and herbal flavors. 116647	Spain		87	15	Galicia	R??as Baixas		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Lagar de Bouza 2015 Albari?ño (R??as Baixas)	Albari?ño	Lagar de Bouza	LT_90_Points	Aromas of nettle, citrus fruits and stream water set up a minerally palate with some plumpness. 88195	Spain		85	19	Northern Spain	Bierzo		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Pazo de Arribi 2010 Godello (Bierzo)	Godello	Pazo de Arribi	LT_90_Points	Round and melony, but also a bit heavy and mealy smelling, indicating that it's starting to turn. 48939	Spain	Dimidium Nobleza	87	17	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Casado Morales 2010 Dimidium Nobleza  (Rioja)	Tempranillo	Casado Morales	LT_90_Points	This Tempranillo is electric purple in color, with aromas of rubber, horse hide and grapy berry. 49156	Spain	Tierra de Estella	86	12	Northern Spain	Navarra		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Fortius 1998 Tierra de Estella Tempranillo (Navarra)	Tempranillo	Fortius	LT_90_Points	From the Valcarlos winery, this Tempranillo has some berry aromas, earth and a bit of grain on the nose. paragraphs.title: Show Lift Chart for Model Evaluation;   Looks Like a Good Predictive Model!
paragraphs.text:
%sql

--Show the Lift Chart for evaluating the model.
--Hint: Change the barchart to a line graph to see how good the model is.

SELECT A.QUANTILE_NUMBER, ROUND(A.GAIN_CUMULATIVE*100,2) GAIN_CUMULATIVE, B.RANDOM_GUESS
FROM Wine_LIFT_TABLE A
, (SELECT QUANTILE_NUMBER, QUANTILE_NUMBER RANDOM_GUESS FROM Wine_LIFT_TABLE) B
WHERE A.QUANTILE_NUMBER = B.QUANTILE_NUMBER;
Select * from DM$VLWINE_CLASS_MODEL_SVM;

paragraphs.title: Let's Explore the Wines that are predicted to be Good Wines
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- COST here refers to a machine learning modeling term and can be ignored
-- Explore the Wines that are predicted to be good wines.
-- Hint : Change the Prediction from the drop down to see the predictions for GT_90_Points / LT_90_Points

SELECT ID, PREDICTION, PROBABILITY FROM Wine_APPLY_RESULT WHERE PREDICTION = ${PREDICTION='GT_90_Points','GT_90_Points'|'LT_90_Points'} order by probability desc;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Show 1,000 Wines that are less than $15 and their predicted Points (looking for really inexpensive GT_90_Points wines)
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Show 1000 Wines which are less than $15 and the predicted Points(looking for inexpensive GT_90_Points wines)

SELECT ID, Price, Country, Designation, Province, Variety, prediction, probability
  FROM (SELECT ID, Price, Country, Designation, Province, Variety,
               PREDICTION_SET(Wine_CLASS_MODEL_SVM USING *) pset
          FROM WINEREVIEWS130KTARGET
         WHERE ID < 1000 and Price < 15) T,
       TABLE(pset) S
ORDER BY prediction, probability desc, ID;

paragraphs.text:
%md
### See how easy machine learning can be inside the Oracle Autonomous Database?   Celebrate with a fine glass of wine!
### Let's now investigate our wine insights and predictions a bit further using Oracle APEX and/or Oracle Analytics Cloud!

msg.data:
See how easy machine learning can be inside the Oracle Autonomous Database? Celebrate with a fine glass of wine!

Let's now investigate our wine insights and predictions a bit further using Oracle APEX and/or Oracle Analytics Cloud!

paragraphs.title: For Running this Notebook Again, Remove Any Previous WinePredictions Table

msg.data:
DROP TABLE WinePredictions PURGE: succeeded


PL/SQL procedure successfully completed.

paragraphs.title: Create WinePredictions table in ADW for Access by Oracle Analytics Cloud
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Create table WinePredictons for viewing in Oracle Analytics Cloud

CREATE TABLE WinePredictions AS 
  SELECT ID, Price, Country, Designation, Province, Variety, prediction, probability
  FROM (SELECT ID, Price, Country, Designation, Province, Variety,
               PREDICTION_SET(Wine_CLASS_MODEL_SVM USING *) pset
          FROM WINEREVIEWS130KTARGET
         WHERE ID < 100000 and Price < 500) T,
       TABLE(pset) S
ORDER BY prediction, probability desc, ID;
